snippet: Drones are becoming a darling of law enforcement officials across the country. But they have prompted  fears of government surveillance, often even before they take to the skies.
abstract: Local and state lawmakers nationwide begin outlining limits for the use of drones by police departments, citing growing fear of government surveillance; technology has gained quick popularity in law enforcement community due to its low-cost efficiency; members of Congress have introduced a bill that would prohibit drones from conducting what it called targeted surveillance of individuals and property without a warrant.
lead_paragraph: Drones are becoming a darling of law enforcement officials across the country. But they have prompted  fears of government surveillance, often even before they take to the skies.

headline.seo: Rise of Drones in U.S. Spurs Efforts to Limit Uses
headline.main: Rise of Drones in U.S. Drives Efforts to Limit Police Use
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Set Limits on Police In Using Drones
